instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Just received a new Medusa 2 and its worked great on newer usb c macbooks however I cant get it to read chips on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards. Tried with the board off nothing connected, the battery only connected and only a/c adapter connected. Also tried with both a/c adapter and battery connected.

What is the correct way to read the bios chip on these?

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Only charger; connect Medusa adapter on J6100 after the charger is plugged in.

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Medusa still  says no chip even with just the charger?

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You MUST insert Medusa adapter on J6100, after Mac is powered up from charger.
Did you do that?

Also be sure J6100 is clean.

Better result if you let charger disconnected and inject external 3V into <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes and as soon as the Medusa is inserted into J6100 the boards powers itself off and Medusa just says no chip seen.

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Solved. Works only with red adapter, not the yellow one.

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you have to do anything different with the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? Trying the same procedure but the Medusa cant see the chip on these

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"Better result if you let charger disconnected and inject external 3V into <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>."
I don't work in other way since a year...

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: While injecting 3v into pad 2 of <RESISTOR>R8133</RESISTOR> the medusa still says no chip seen (H). <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> does read 3v on pin 2 of <CHIP>U8130</CHIP>. What am I missing?

threads.title: medusa 2 read bios <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Maybe bad chip, traces?
Did you try with other 3437 board?
Remove the chip and use A4064 adapter.

Also can be corrosion underneath J6100...
